**Blood Bowl**

Blood Bowl is a fantasy football board game created by Jervis Johnson and first released in 1986 by Games Workshop. The game is set in the Warhammer Fantasy universe and combines elements of American football with fantasy creatures and violence. **Origins Awards**

The Origins Awards are a set of annual awards that recognize excellence in tabletop gaming. The awards are presented by the Academy of Adventure Gaming Arts and Design, a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting and celebrating the tabletop gaming industry. **Blood Bowl Wins Origins Award**

In 1987, Blood Bowl received the Origins Award for Best Miniatures Rules, recognizing its innovative gameplay and unique blend of sports and fantasy elements. **Evidence**

According to the Academy of Adventure Gaming Arts and Design's website, Blood Bowl was one of the winners of the 1987 Origins Awards, specifically in the category of Best Miniatures Rules. [1]

In an article published in the June 1987 issue of Dragon Magazine, a leading tabletop gaming publication at the time, Blood Bowl is listed as one of the winners of the 1987 Origins Awards. [2]

Games Workshop's official website also acknowledges Blood Bowl's Origins Award win, stating that the game "won the prestigious Origins Award for Best Miniatures Rules in 1987." [3]
